body:
i tried and it did not work. i can't see why. nothing in the logs.
when using bootstapd on the same server that works fine.

did anybody successfully run a normal toxnode as tcp relay?

comment_data.body:
according to my info this is all you need to activate TCP relay:
https://github.com/zoff99/ToxTCP-RelayNode/blob/master/tox_tcp_relay/tox_tcp_relay.c#L531

1. Do you have the tcp relay option enabled in tox-boostrapd's configuration file?

2. What does tox-boostrapd output in the logs?

3. How do you detect that it's not working?

4. What are the outputs of `netstat -nltup` and `netstat -natup` when ran as root?

5. Do you have any firewall configured on the machine you run tox-bootstrapd on, potentially locking it? What is the output of `iptables -vL` and `ip6tables -vL` when ran as root?

@nurupo not tox-boostrapd. tox-boostrapd  is working fine as tcp relay.
but a normal tox node (client) should also work as TCP relay. and that i can not get to work.
so i am wondering: is it really possible to use a regular tox node (client) as tcp relay?
if so: exmaple code? proof?
What exactly did you do (provide code) and how did you verify that it doesn't work? Just saying that you can't get it to work is not very helpful in identifying what the issue may be.

as stated:
i used this code https://github.com/zoff99/ToxTCP-RelayNode/blob/master/tox_tcp_relay/tox_tcp_relay.c
compiled like this https://circleci.com/gh/zoff99/ToxTCP-RelayNode/26

then used the IP/port and pubkey as a tcp relay in another client. the other client tried to connect but did never go online. there was no useful logging output on both nodes what the problem was

use pubkey from the logout:
```
cd tox_tcp_relay ; cat ./tox_tcp_relay.log

E:TCP relay port: 33447
E:setting UDP mode
D:tox_new2:TOX_ERR_NEW = 0
D:local discovery enabled = 1
D:tox = 0x2340fc0
D:nodeslist:1
I:--MyToxID--:E2373460CC671F7C2A7DD63BB3EB05B9DD8FBEDB9FA517E64B58D0B083BF131BCF354BB62B80
I:avatar_set:001
D:avatar_set:002
D:avatar_set:003
D:avatar_set:004
D:avatar_set:099
I:Tox online, took 9 seconds
I:new Tox AV
I:AV iterate Thread successfully createdI:AV video Thread successfully createdI:av_thread_lock created successfully
I:AV Thread #-1331329280: starting
I:av_thread_lock video created successfully
I:AV video Thread #-1339721984: starting
```
this is just an exmaple log output. not running now!

@nurupo does the TCP relay node need to be in TCP mode? i used UDP mode.
and i saw (with netstat) that is was listening on port 33447
Can you provide a minimal example? 3000 lines of code is a bit too much.

its echobot code basically. i can strip it down. the code works fine as normal node.
has anybody ever used a normal node as tcp realy, is basically what i am asking?

>@nurupo does the TCP relay node need to be in TCP mode?

No, specifying a `tcp_port` in `Tox_Options` should be enough.
hmm. i will make a test setup on CI. to make it reproduceable
Make sure you are using the correct public key when calling `tox_add_tcp_relay()`. It should be the same as your DHT key, which is not exposed through the public API.
what publickey should i use? where do i see it? i only the have normal pubkey of the tcp relay node.

~~~DHT and TCP server public keys are not exposed in public API. You'd need to dig into toxcore's private internals if you want to access them, similarly to what tox-boostrapd does.~~~

EDIT: see https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/589#issuecomment-339876412

so then my issue is valid.
at the moment it is NOT possible to use a normal tox node as TCP relay (because you are not able to get the needed pubkey)

I don't think it's meant to be used like that. ~~~It's true that you can't get DHT and TCP server public keys though API, so you can't tell someone to use your node as DHT bootstrap node or TCP relay server.~~~ But if you could, it would be very inconvenient, because unlike Tox Id, every time you restart a client, your DHT and TCP server public keys change, so whoever was using you as a DHT or TCP relay server node won't be able to connect anymore. That's why we have a tox-boostrapd, which has unchanging DHT and TCP server keys.

As far as I understand, when you enable a tcp server in a client, all it does is telling other DHT nodes that your node supports TCP relaying, so that they could connect to it if they wanted.

~~~So your issue is invalid, toxcore is not meant to be used that way, which is why this public key information is not in the API.~~~

Edit: see https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/589#issuecomment-339876412
I don't know, I'm not familiar with low-level details of how toxcore works and its spec much. If you want to know, check the spec. I think that this is what it doing, but I might be wrong.
the spec does not matter. we just proofed it does not work now.
What does not work? What did you prove? I lost you.
it proofs that you can not run a normal tox node and use that as TCP relay in the settings of your other tox client. but the kind of what the docs suggest.

This feature definitely would give even more power to users of making strong Tox network and new nodes = harder to ban certain IP-s by countries who censor internet. If not by default then maybe global command that can be enabled by passing command to client like --node or something similar for example.

Huh, I'm sorry, apparently I have missed `void tox_self_get_dht_id(const Tox *tox, uint8_t *dht_id);` function in the API, so there is a way to get DHT key from the API. TCP server and DHT keys are the same, so you can use this key for your TCP server needs. Maybe we should add a separate function for the TCP server key or improve the documentation for `tox_self_get_dht_id()` saying that the same key is used for TCP server.

rename.from: running a normal tox node as tcp relay is not working
rename.to: running a normal tox node as tcp relay is not possible

labels.description: Bug fix for the user, not a fix to a build script
labels.name: bug

title: running a normal tox node as tcp relay is not possible
